org.jppf.client.event

Class JobListenerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jppf.client.event.JobListenerAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, JobListener

    public class JobListenerAdapter
extends Object
implements JobListener
    A convenience class which allows subclassing and implementing only the needed methods of JobListener.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobListenerAdapter() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void jobDispatched(JobEvent event)
      Called when a job, or a subset of its tasks, is sent to the server, or to the local executor.
      void jobEnded(JobEvent event)
      Called when the execution of a job is complete.
      void jobReturned(JobEvent event)
      Called when the execution of a subset of the tasks of a job is complete.
      void jobStarted(JobEvent event)
      Called when the execution of a job is starting.

      • JobListenerAdapter

        public JobListenerAdapter()

    • Method Detail

      • jobStarted

        public void jobStarted(JobEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Called when the execution of a job is starting. This method may be called multiple times, in the case where the job is resubmitted, due to a broken connection to the server for instance.
        Specified by:
        jobStarted in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        event - encapsulates the event that caused this method to be called.

      • jobEnded

        public void jobEnded(JobEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Called when the execution of a job is complete. This method may be called multiple times, in the case where the job is resubmitted, due to a broken connection to the server for instance.
        Specified by:
        jobEnded in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        event - encapsulates the event that caused this method to be called.

      • jobDispatched

        public void jobDispatched(JobEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Called when a job, or a subset of its tasks, is sent to the server, or to the local executor.

        This method may be called multiple times, depending on the client load-balancer configuration, and on how it will split the jobs into subsets of their tasks.

        Specified by:
        jobDispatched in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        event - encapsulates the event that caused this method to be called.

      • jobReturned

        public void jobReturned(JobEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Called when the execution of a subset of the tasks of a job is complete.

        This method may be called multiple times, depending on the client load-balancer configuration, and on how it will split the jobs into subsets of their tasks.

        Specified by:
        jobReturned in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        event - encapsulates the event that caused this method to be called.
